title: Wednesday Dots : Teams of the Week
body_text:
“Never tell me the odds!” - Han Solo, Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back
Wednesday Dots: Teams of the Week
Both the UW Men’s and Women’s Basketball team were the Teams of the Week and Troy Fautanu won the Morris Trophy.
We won’t talk about UW’s odds to win in the Sugar Bowl or the National Championship Game-at least partly because UW has been good at defying the odds.
Football Dots
- Troy Fautanu wins the Morris Trophy for the top offensive lineman in the Pac-12 (as voted by the players).
- ESPN talks about how UW built its roster ($), and asks if UW is “America’s Team” in the CFP. (If the video doesn’t show-or work-below, it should be on this site.)
- Dan Raley looks at which Huskies are showing up on NFL Mock Drafts. Rome Odunze appeared in the first round in 9 of 10 mock drafts that he looked at. Bralen Trice appeared in the first round in 8 of 10 mock drafts. Michael Penix Jr. appeared in the first round in just 3 of the 10 mock drafts. Troy Fautanu was in 4 of 10 mock drafts. And Ja’Lynn Polk appeared in 1 of the 10.
- UW’s Special Teams is #5 in the country according to Pro Football Focus.
- UW will be hosting some transfers in the next week. This article from Roman Tomashoff talks about some. Here are some Tweets about those and a few others that are currently known.
- Jalen McMillan, Ja’Lynn Polk, and Dillon Johnson will be signing autographs next Thursday (Dec. 21) at 6:30 PM at Mill Creek Sports.
UW Athletics Dots
- Jon Wilner has UW #6 in his Pac-12 Men’s Basketball Power Rankings.
- Was the win over Gonzaga just the beginning for the UW Men’s Basketball team?
- Both the UW Men’s and Women’s Basketball teams were the ESPN Team of the Week.
- The UW Women’s team was also the USBWA Team of the Week.
- UW’s May Pertofsky is the first Husky drafted into the Pro Volleyball Federation. She was drafted by the Atlanta Vibe.
- UW athletes partnered with the Forgotten Childrens Fund to do some gift-wrapping.
Bonus Dot
- Reflections on the one year anniversary of Mike Leach’s passing.
